text: Yevgeny Pavlovich Krylatov (; 23 February 1934 â€“ 8 May 2019) was a Russian composer. He wrote songs for over 120 Soviet and Russian live-action and animated movies. He created music for movies such as Film, Film, Film (1968), Property of the Republic (1971), Three from Prostokvashino (1978), The Adventures of the Elektronic (1979), Lilac Ball (1987) and Don't Leave... (1989). He was awarded People's Artist of Russia in 1994. He was born in Lysva. Krylatov died of pneumonia on 8 May 2019 in Moscow. He was 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in Russia Category:Disease-related deaths in Moscow Category:Russian composers
title: Yevgeny Krylatov
